revised_title: Investigating Changes in the Relative Situation of Double Stars
tldr: The author examines the changes in the relative position of double stars, specifically Castor, using new tables of proper motions and observations made by the Astronomer Royal at Greenwich. The study investigates the effects of parallax and the motions of the stars, concluding that the observed changes cannot be solely attributed to the motion of the solar system or a single star's motion.
